subject: Science
title: Solar Panels: Light to Electricity
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Solar Panels: Light to Electricity.

hook.text: Solar panels turn sunlight directly into electricity ‚Äî no turbines, no steam, no moving parts.

buildup.text: They use the photovoltaic effect, discovered by Edmond Becquerel in 1839.

discovery.text: Photons from sunlight knock electrons loose in silicon. This creates a flow of current.

twist.text: Modern panels convert only about 20-25% of sunlight into electricity. The rest becomes heat.

climax.text: Solar is now the cheapest new electricity source in most of the world.

punchline.text: Sunlight hits silicon and electrons flow. No burning, no spinning, no noise.

quiz.question: How do solar panels generate electricity?
options: Photons knock electrons loose in silicon, creating current
Sunlight heats water to spin a turbine
Solar radiation charges a chemical battery
